file_content.text: I haven't heard from Seh-run yet... but give it time. He'll grow strong.
You did what was necessary. I wipe my hands of the situation with Seh-run.
Find Seh-run and poison it. This must be done.
If you're going to feed Seh-run, go and do so.
What do you want? I'm training slaves to feed the beasts, and I don't have time to chat.
Have you heard of a creature called Seh-run?
I met an alien in the tombs.
And you are?
I am Overseer Prithor. If you have business with me, I'd know what it is.
I'm here about a scavenger that escaped the Academy--a creature called Seh-run.
There was this alien....
Seh-run? You know of Seh-run?
Have you been feeding scraps to creatures outside the beast pens?
Tell me about the meat.
What? Only Seh-run....
My business is that freak pet of yours. The one that talks and gibbers about itself?
You let a monster loose.
You've seen... you've seen Seh-run? I thought it was lost in the Wilds.
I'm here for a "special meal." You know the kind.
Someone sent me for "food."
You--you've been talking to Seh-run, haven't you?
That creature was... close to me when I was an acolyte. It helped me survive my trials; it traveled places I couldn't, told me everything it heard and saw.
It had been living off vermin before I came along. I figured out a way to make it healthier, stronger--Seh-run's "special meals."
What is Seh-run, exactly? I've never seen anything like it.
Tell me about the creature.
Its people come from the planet Byss, but it's lived on Korriban as long as anyone can remember.
Go on.
It seems too pitiful to be useful.
It's pathetic.
I thought the same thing, at first. I didn't realize.
A creature so wretched could never be strong.
It's pathetic.
You might be surprised.
Seh-run never knew exactly what I fed it. Its meals weren't just beast fodder--Seh-run ate the corpses of the Academy's failures, the bones and blood of dead acolytes.
Feeding on their energy after death, it grew exponentially more powerful with every meal and became strong in the dark side.
You fed the corpses of dead students to that thing?
You gave it what?
The sludge we feed to the slaves and the tuk'ata wouldn't have sated Seh-run. And bodies pile up quickly here--it was an easy way to dispose of them.
Bad idea.
Pity I didn't have your insight at the time.
How did a fool like you become an overseer?
Idiot.
Maybe taking Seh-run was a mistake, but I was--we were strong together.
When I saw how twisted Seh-run was becoming, I sent it away. It was becoming hungrier all the time, and I feared it would attack the living.
Destroying it seemed impossible--it could heal any injury it suffered. I hoped it would find a new home somewhere, but it seems we must act more decisively.
Oh?
We could. Or I could give it the meal it wants.
I'd rather help it.
Aid Seh-run, and it will turn on us. One more taste of power, and it will begin hunting acolytes. I can't allow that.
I'll destroy Seh-run.
No! That is... Seh-run may not be strong enough to kill acolytes on its own, but it can't be slain. Its regenerative abilities draw on the power of the Force.
Together, we must poison Seh-run.
Before I sent Seh-run away, I developed a powerful toxin--but I didn't have the heart to use it. It won't kill the creature, but it should strip it of its power.
So let's say we poison it--what happens to Seh-run then?
And? After that?
My best guess?
Excellent.
I take some pride in the formula.
Seh-run helped you. It adored you. How can you be so ungrateful?
You'd hurt it?
If I thought I could keep that thing, I would! I tried, but Seh-run isn't what it used to be. Poisoning it would be merciful.
If we do this, Seh-run won't survive much longer. It will hide as best it can and slowly starve. But the alternative is to let it become a living horror.
Seh-run needs to become strong. It needs its food.
I'm feeding it.
Seh-run's not loyal to the Sith, not to me, and certainly not loyal to you.
But... I have a degree of loyalty to the creature. If this is what you insist on doing, I'll give you what Seh-run wants.
Perhaps the creature will prove useful again. It's an interesting experiment, if nothing else.
Seh-run might be valuable.
We can learn something from its strength. It's strong in the dark side.
Respect the creature's might.
Perhaps.
It's appreciated.
Stay out of trouble.
I believe I take your point.
This should be what you need. Feed it to Seh-run, and the creature will have the strength it desires.
Let's hope we're not making a mistake.
Then let's poison that thing.
Seh-run can't continue.
I'm glad you see it as I do.
I'm giving you this meat. Don't ask me where it came from, but it should fool Seh-run. Once the poison is in its system, it will weaken.
I take no satisfaction in this--but it is necessary.
I have no time for you, now--I must attend to my work.
